snippet: Charles J. Hynes, who has held the job for 23 years, has raised far less money than his challenger, Kenneth P. Thompson, and has encountered a series of controversies.
abstract: Brooklyn District Atty Charles J Hynes, who has held job for 23 years, has raised far less money than his challenger Kenneth P Thompson and has been plagued by series of controversies surrounding his campaign; Hynes has raised $210,00 of estimated $1 million needed to win re-election, while Thompson has raised about $410,000.
lead_paragraph: Charles J. Hynes, who has held the job for 23 years, has raised far less money than his challenger, Kenneth P. Thompson, and has encountered a series of controversies.

headline.main: Hynes Faces Tough Road in Brooklyn District Attorney Race
headline.print_headline: Hynes Faces Tough Road In District Attorney Race
